stadium.name: The Old Fort
stadium.description: The team plays within the crumbling, stone-ringed ruins of an ancient hill-fort. The 'runes' are just old, weathered carvings on the standing stones that serve as obstacles.

stats.pregame_ritual: Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Patting every beast of burden they see on the way to the match.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Spitting into their own hand and then slapping their face with it.
Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
A toast of goat's milk to the health of their rivals.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Patting every beast of burden they see on the way to the match.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.

Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.

stadium.name: The Buccaneer's Bowl
stadium.description: A flashy, pristine stadium built on a private beach exclusively for resort guests. The field is imported turf, and a massive, puppet kraken in the bay entertains the crowd at halftime.

stats.pregame_ritual: Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Sticking leeches to their legs to 'lighten their step'.
Bribing a local oracle with a meat pie for a vague prophecy.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Thanking their armor for the protection it's about to offer.
Painting their teeth with a mixture of charcoal and water.
Doing a series of loud, guttural breathing exercises.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Sticking leeches to their legs to 'lighten their step'.
Bribing a local oracle with a meat pie for a vague prophecy.

preGame: # üéôÔ∏è TUESDAY NIGHT TROLLBALL PRE-GAME REPORT: THE RUIN RUMBLE! üèüÔ∏è Well, pull up a crate and lend me your ears, sports fans! This is Nok the Corrupter, the demon with the dream, broadcasting live from the misty ruins of The Old Fort! We‚Äôve got a real barn-burner for the final week of the season as the Kerlauger Runeguard look to hold their ground against the flashy Tortell Privateers! I‚Äôm looking down at the field, and folks, the pre-game jitters are real! Keisling Damalas is over there painting his teeth with charcoal‚Äînow that‚Äôs a winning smile only a mother could love! Meanwhile, Lilithe Royce is letting leeches have a snack on her legs! Talk about a literal blood-letting before the first whistle! If only those boring Haven Lights had that much backbone, they might actually be interesting to watch! On the home side, the Runeguard are keeping it grim among the mossy rocks. Reginauld Cordell is busy tracing sigils over his heart, likely praying to some dusty god for a bit of luck on this uneven footing! Gurney Fadiman is doing a pre-match toast with goat‚Äôs milk‚Äîdisgusting stuff, I‚Äôd rather drink a flagon of soul-rot with Pirate Prince Rory! The fog is rolling in so thick you could lose an arm and not find it until halftime, and the stands are looking a bit empty‚ÄîI guess the locals are too busy hiding from Dame Terra Monteforte‚Äôs dirt-magic to show up! This is the last stop before the playoffs, folks! Will the Privateers plunder the fort with their fancy imported turf attitudes, or will the Runeguard leave them buried in the ancient dirt? Personally, I hope they both knock each other into the next reality so they can experience the joy of respawning first-hand! My Ebon Gate Corruptors are already sharpening their axes for the post-season, but tonight, it's all about the mud, the runes, and the glorious sound of clashing steel! Let‚Äôs get this Trollball rolling!
postGame: # üèÜ POST-GAME WRAP-UP: PLUNDERED AND BLUNDERED! üèÜ What a crackerjack of a match, folks! The final score is in, and the Tortell Privateers have narrowly escaped the crumbling walls of The Old Fort with a 5 to 4 victory over the Kerlauger Runeguard! The game opened with a frantic scramble as Reginauld Cordell wrestled the troll head away from the ancient ruins in the Away Field, proving that a little fog can‚Äôt stop a man who‚Äôs spent his morning tracing sigils on his chest! It wasn't long before Johnna Beetner gave the few fans in attendance something to hoot about, slicing through the defense like a hot knife through butter to dunk that leather head for the opening point! But hold onto your hats, because the violence was the real star tonight! Vivia Namara was an absolute wrecking crew, sending Goldberg Tova and Castorina Gies to the dirt with tackles that sounded like a stone tower collapsing! The Runeguard looked like they might actually pull off an upset when Shepperd Trefler launched a magnificent shot from the Away Field, netting two points and making the Privateers look as distracted as a tourist at Toast Island! However, Eugen Zacks was a miracle worker on the sidelines, slapping helmets and getting the Privateers back on their feet faster than a respawning adventurer escaping the Demon Prison! Melisande Eustacia led the comeback charge, finding the End Zone for a gritty dunk that turned the tide and silenced those synchronized Runeguard chants that were echoing off the runes! The real heart-breaker for the locals was Loralee Sunny, who clearly read her knuckle-bone fortunes correctly, nailing a shot from distance to level the playing field and put the Privateers ahead! We saw a regular parade of pain today, with Kidder Starkey and Harilda Sigsmond taking some heavy hits, and Johnna Beetner making sure Ellan Elburt learned exactly what a scimitar feels like in the ribs! I‚Äôve got to say, the uneven footing of this stadium did more work than the Runeguard defense in the second half, causing more fumbles than a kissless Brennen Farno at a social mixer! As the fog swallows the stadium, the White Ravens look a bit bedraggled‚Äîmaybe Colm‚Äôs cursed handshake is rubbing off on the whole team, because they couldn't catch a break or a ball when it mattered! So the Privateers sail away with the win, leaving the Runeguard to count their pebbles and nurse their bruises! This is Nok the Corrupter signing off, reminding you that if you aren't bleeding, you aren't playing! Goodnight, Osterra!
